titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Early Intervention in Psychosis Service - Description

div.p: An Early Intervention in Psychosis (EIP) Service is a type of Mental Health Service.

An Early Intervention in Psychosis Service is a specialist community SERVICE providing care and treatment to people who are experiencing their first episode of psychosis, and for those who are at high risk of developing psychosis.
The overarching aim of an Early Intervention in Psychosis Service is to reduce the duration of untreated psychosis and produce effective outcomes in terms of recovery and reduction in relapse rates.
